title: The One Where Monica and Richard Are Friends

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Video Store, Monica is running in to return a video.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to clerk) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CLERK
dialogue.text: Six dollars, please.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Six? I just had it for one night. It’s three.

dialogue.speaker: CLERK
dialogue.text: Eight o’clock is the cut-off and, (looks at his watch) aww, it’s 8:02.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know in a weird way, you have too much power. Look, you’re gonna have to help me out here, ‘cause I only have three.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: (standing behind her, without his moustache) I can help with that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God. Richard? (turns around) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! Your lip went bald. (Richard pays the clerk) Hey, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: So, you look great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: No you do. You... just...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: You’ve got panties stuck to your leg.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (removes them) That’s because I-I was just grabbing some things out of the dryer, and it’s static cling. Or maybe it’s just that God knew I’d be running into you and saw an opportunity.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: It’s good to see you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s good to see you too.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Video Store, Monica is running in to return a video.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You see that guy? He’s in classics now, but y'know as soon as we leave he’s going straight to the porn.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: He’s gonna go up to the counter with Citizen Kane , Vertigo , and Clockwork Orgy. (they both laugh) This is nice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: I missed this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Me too.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: So, you wanna get a hamburger or something?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, um, I don’t know if that’s a good idea.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Oh. Look, just friends, I won’t grope you. I promise.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, I just I think that it’s too soon.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: No it’s not too soon, I had lunch at a eleven.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Ross. Joey, and Rachel are eating breakfast.
Chandler is holding a bottle of Hersey’s Syrup .]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, baby!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Making chocolate milk. Do you want some?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No thanks. I’m 29.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looking at her watch) Oh my God, I gotta go to work!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh sweetie, when do you think you’re going to get off tonight?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh I don’t know honey. It’s gonna be really late.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh come on, not again.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know. I’m sorry. Look, I’ll make a deal with you all right? Okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: For every night that you’re asleep before I get home from work...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I will wake you up in a way that’s proved very popular in the past.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Now, if you need to stay late, I want to be supportive of that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering, holding a pair of Roller Blades) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Look at you. Since when do you roller blade?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! Since tomorrow. I met this really cute guy in the park and he like y'know, jogs, and blades, and swims, and so y'know we made a deal that’s he’s going to teach me all sorts of jock stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And what are you going to do for him?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m going to let him.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cool.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering from her bedroom) Morning.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Somebody got in late last night.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah well, I ran into Richard.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: When did this happen?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, um, around 8:02. We ah, talked for a little while, and then um, we went out for an innocent burger.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, there’s no such thing as an innocent burger.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, are you gonna see him again?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Tomorrow night.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, she spent the last six months getting over him, and now she’s celebrating that by going on a date with him.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s not a date, okay. I’m just gonna teach him how to make lasagne for some pot luck dinner he has.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, you might wanna make a little extra, y'know you’ll probably be hungry after the sex.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We’re not gonna have sex! Okay, nothing’s changed here. He still doesn’t want children and I still do, so that’s why we’re just gonna be friends.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Naked friends.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Ross. Joey, and Rachel are eating breakfast.
Chandler is holding a bottle of Hersey’s Syrup .]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do you have any ice?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Check the freezer. If there’s none in there, then we’re probably out. Are you just getting in from work? It’s late.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. I had the greatest day though, I got to sit in on the meeting with the reps from Calvin Klien . I told my boss I liked this line of lingerie, she ordered a ton of it. How was your day?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I discovered I’m able to count all of my teeth using just my tongue.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hmm. (she opens the freezer) Umm, why do you have a copy of The Shining in your freezer?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, I was reading it last night, and I got scared, so.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But ah, you’re safe from it if it’s in the freezer?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, safer. Y'know, I mean I never start reading The Shining , without making sure we’ve got plenty of room in the freezer, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How often do you read it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Haven’t you ever read the same book over and over again?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, umm, I guess I read Little Women more than once. But I mean that’s a classic, what’s so great about The Shining ?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The question should be Rach, what is not so great about The Shining . Okay?

dialogue.speaker: AND THE ANSWER WOULD BE
dialogue.text: nothing. All right? This is like the scariest book ever. I bet it’s way better than that classic of yours.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Ah, well we’ll just see about that, okay. I will read The Shining , (she tries to take the book away from him but he doesn’t want to let it go) and you will read Little Women .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, you got it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah, now Rach, these ah, these little women.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How little are they? I mean, are they like scary little?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there, Phoebe is entering with her date
Robert.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, Chandler, Ross, this is Robert.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Robert) You’ve have lipstick right here (points to her cheek). That’s okay, it’s mine, we just kissed.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Robert) So ah, isn’t a bit cold out for shorts?

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Well, I’m from California.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Right, right. Sometimes you guys just burst into flames.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (standing up) I’m up! I’m up, I’ve gotten up now! Anybody ah, want anything?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’ll have coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Yeah, me too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, make that three.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay Ross, why don’t you come with me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. (goes over to the counter) (to Chandler) What ah, what is the matter with you? What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Robert’s coming out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, what do you mean, what? Is he gay?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. He.....he’s coming out of his shorts.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The man is showing brain.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Are you sure? (

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER NODS
dialogue.text: Yes!) Hold on. (walks over behind the couch) I’m sorry you guys, that was a coffee and a....

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: We could write it down for you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, that won’t be ah, that won’t be necessary (leans down and looks up Robert’s shorts, seeing Robert’s package.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Wellll?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What do we do? What do we do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose we just try to not look directly at it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Like an eclipse.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there, Phoebe is entering with her date
Robert.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is teaching Richard how to make lasagne.]

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: So when people complement me on my cooking should I, what do I say?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You say ‘Thank you very much,’ and then you buy me something pretty. Come on, we’re gonna put are hands in this bowl, and we’re gonna start squishing the tomatoes.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Ew, this feels very weird.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You touch people’s eyeballs every day and this feels weird.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, sure I touch them, but I spent years learning not to squish them. (Monica grabs his hand in the tomatoes.) That’s my hand.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oops.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Gotta keep squishing.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Tomatoes are squishing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Op.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, gosh, you got some on your shirt.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hold on a second, just put a little club soda on it (does so) and it should umm, be.....

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Umm, you’ve got some on your pants.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: I’ll just throw them out.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is teaching Richard how to make lasagne.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is watching Joey read Little Women , Ross is also
there.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: These little women. Wow!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Your liking it, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! Amy just burned Jo’s manuscript. I don’t see how he could ever forgive her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Umm, Jo’s a girl, it’s short for Josephine.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: But Jo’s got a crush on Laurie. (Ross nods his head) Oh. You mean it’s like a girl-girl thing? ‘Cause that is the one thing missing from The Shining .

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, actually Laurie’s a boy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No wonder Rachel had to read this so many times.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey! How’d the ah, basketball go?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay, I learned how to shoot a lay-up, a foul shot, and a twenty-three pointer.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You mean a three pointer?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I get more because I’m dainty.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: So um, is there a phone here, I can check my messages?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, in the back. You want a quarter?

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Oh, no thanks. I always carry one in my sock.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (noticing Chandler) What are you doing? (he pushes Chandler back to his side of the couch) Get back over on your side of the... (sees Robert in all his glory) Hello!! (to Robert) Hi, I’m Joey, we haven’t met.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, good to meet you. Robert.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What? (the guys keep laughing.) What? You guys, what is going on? You not like Robert? (the guys keep laughing.) Why are you laughing?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Calm down. There’s no reason to get testy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You guys!! Come on!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I’m sorry, it just seems that Robert isn’t as concealed in the shorts area, as ah, one may have hoped.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Hey. (sits down)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey Robert, could you ah, ha, pass me those cookies?

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Sure.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is watching Joey read Little Women , Ross is also
there.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is talking to Richard on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, how’d the lasagne go over? (listens) Really?! Good. So you owe me three pretty things. (listens) Yeah, I’ve been thinking a lot about you too. (listens) I know. It’s hard this whole platonic thing. (listens) It’s a word!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, I do think it’s better this way. (listens) Yeah, we’re being smart. (gets up to answer the door) (listens) Yes, I’m sure.(she opens the door and it’s Richard)

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: You really sure?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I’ll call you back. (starts kissing him)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is talking to Richard on the phone.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica’s bedroom, she’s in bed with Richard.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So we can be friends who sleep together.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Absolutely, this will just be something we do, like racquetball.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sounds smart and healthy to me. So um, just out of curiosity, um, do you currently have any other racquetball buddies?

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Just your dad. (pause) Although that’s actually racquetball. You know I-I do have a blind date with my sister’s neighbour next Tuesday.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: You want me to cancel it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No! (pushes him) No!

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ‘Cause if you do that means you’d be cancelling it for me, and we’re just friends.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Exactly. (pushes her back)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica’s bedroom, she’s in bed with Richard.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Robert is picking up Phoebe for a date.]

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey. Ooh! Don’t sit down!

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: You ready to go to the batting cage?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. And, first here’s a gift.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Oh! Wow! Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Stretchy pants! Why, those are the greatest things in the world! If I were you I would wear them every day, every day!

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Jeez, thank you really that is so nice. But um, to be honest, I don’t think I can wear these, they’re so tight, I feel like I’m on display. I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s all right, that’s well, I figured.... (they start to leave as Joey enters.)

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey! (starts to laugh.) How’s it going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach, how you doing with The Shining ?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Danny just went into room 217.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oooh, the next part’s the best, when that dead lady in the bathtub...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, no, meh-nah-nah-nah, come on you’re gonna ruin it!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right I’ll talk in code. (to Ross and Chandler) Remember when the kid sees those two blanks in the hallway?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hmmm, that’s very cool.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, all blank, and no blank, make’s blank a blank blank. Oh no-no-no, no, the end when Jack almost kills them all with that blank, but then at last second they get away. Aww!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Joey! I can’t believe you just did that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can’t believe she cracked your code!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, okay, Laurie proposes to Jo, and she says no, even though she’s still in love with him, and then he ends up marring Amy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey! Mine was by accident! All right, the boiler explodes and destroys the hotel, and kills the dad.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Eh. Beth dies.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Beth, Beth dies?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um-hmm.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Is that true? If I keep reading is Beth gonna die?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, Beth doesn’t die, she doesn’t die. Does she Rachel?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey’s asking if you’ve just ruined the first book he’s ever loved that didn’t star Jack Nicholson?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. She doesn’t die.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then why would you say that?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Because, I wanted to hurt you.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: (running in) Oh, there they are! I-I dropped my keys.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (gasps) Oh my....

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Got ‘em.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Robert is picking up Phoebe for a date.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading The Shining , as Monica enters.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (screams and grabs a potato masher to defend herself) Sorry. I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, (opens her coat revealing a large burn mark over her left breast.) in a grill fire.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you smiling at?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I was just thinking you’re day could still pick up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, right.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I love this friend thing!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading The Shining , as Monica enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Listen, Robert’s gonna be here any second so, will one of you just tell him?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Please, right now, no, every time I see him it’s like ‘Is it on the lose?’ ‘Is it watching me?’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We can’t tell him, you can’t go up to a guy you barely know and talk about his.... stuff.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He’s right, even if it’s to say something complementary. (He stops and thinks about what he just said.)

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) So are ready for the gym? They’ve got this new rock climbing wall, we can spot each other.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I can spot you from here.

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, listen Robert...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Hey, don’t we have to...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, we got, um-hmm.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, I think you’re really, really great...

dialogue.speaker: ROBERT
dialogue.text: Oh God! Here we go again. Why does this keep happening to me? (spreads his legs) Is it something I’m putting out there? Is this my fault? Or am I just nuts?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I-I-I-I-I don’t know, I don’t know what to say.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (cleaning up the table) (to Robert) Hey buddy, this is a family place, put the mouse back in the house.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Richard’s bedroom, Monica has covered it in rose pedals and candles. We
hear Richard come in to the apartment, and Monica frantically throws the rest of the
pedals on the bed, and jumps onto the bed and puts a rose in her mouth, and bites a
thorn.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ow!

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: (outside the bedroom) Really?! Well, it’s just like everyone else’s apartment. It’s got rooms, walls, and ceilings.

dialogue.speaker: S DATE
dialogue.text: Well, I just wanted to see where you lived. Now, give me the tour.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! (She frantically tries to clean up the bedroom as Richard starts the tour.)

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Ah well, this is the living room.

dialogue.speaker: S DATE
dialogue.text: Impressive.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: All right. This is the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: S DATE
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s real pretty. Wait a minute, don’t I get to see the bedroom?

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: The bedroom. Well it’s pretty much your typical... (opens the door as Monica hides under the covers, and quickly closes the door before his date can see the room.) bedroom.

dialogue.speaker: S DATE
dialogue.text: We’re still on this side of the door.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Um-hmm.

dialogue.speaker: S DATE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but I didn’t get to see it.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Oh shoot! Maybe next time. (yawns) Thanks for a lovely evening. (shows her out)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (still hiding under the blankets) So um, who was she?

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Oh, (laughs) that was the blind date that I told you about, she called and switched it to today.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (still hiding under the blankets) Did you like her? And I’m just asking as a friend, because I am totally fine with this.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Well, you seem fine.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gets up) Okay, y'know what, I’m not fine, I’m not. I mean how can I be fine, hearing you come in with her, she wants to see your bedroom.... (pause) Y'know what, what if we’re friends who don’t see other people?

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: You mean like exclusive friends?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why not?! I mean this has been the most amazing week. Would it be so terrible? Even if we were friends who lived together. Or, maybe someday friends who stood up in front of their other friends, and vowed to be friends forever.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Wow. Y'know we’re back where we were. Honey, I would love to do all that, but nothing’s changed.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s not true, you don’t have a moustache.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, one thing’s changed. But we still want different things and we know how this is gonna end.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what, I’ve got to walk out of here right now, ‘cause getting over you is the hardest thing that I have ever had to do. I don’t think I could do it again.

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: I know I couldn’t. So....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How ‘bout one last game of racquetball?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Watch the thorns!

dialogue.speaker: RICHARD
dialogue.text: (lying down) Ow!!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Richard’s bedroom, Monica has covered it in rose pedals and candles. We
hear Richard come in to the apartment, and Monica frantically throws the rest of the
pedals on the bed, and jumps onto the bed and puts a rose in her mouth, and bites a
thorn.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering, and he’s very dejected.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Beth is really, really sick.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Awwww.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Jo’s there, but I don’t think there’s anything she could do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Joey?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Do you want to put the book in the freezer?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (nodding his head) Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering, and he’s very dejected.]
